availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper with a Democratic, antislavery focus. Operated in 1863. Publisher and editor from 1844 to 1868: John Hopkins Harney. Publisher in 1860: William E. Hughes.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 1104.
The Encyclopedia of Louisville, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2015), 366, 656.
Bryan S. Bush, Louisville and the Civil War: A History & Guide, Charleston, SC: History Press, 2008.
